children.value: version 0.27.0! This release contains several new features for advanced users, along with many core stability improvements and bug fixes to the Hummingbot client.
We're also starting to see more external contributions from the Hummingbot community. See
for more information on contributing to Hummingbot.

<Callout
  type="tip"
  body="`Introducing the Hummingbot Public Roadmap` To communicate the status of bug fixes and planned improvements, we recently began to publish the [Hummingbot Public Roadmap]. We will keep this page updated, so please bookmark this page to see the newest updates to the Hummingbot codebase."
  link={["https://github.com/CoinAlpha/hummingbot/projects/2"]}
/>
, we introduce a new parameter in the Pure Market Making (PMM) strategy:
. This allows you to set a tolerance level for refreshing orders so that the bot only cancels and replaces orders if the market price has moved by more than a certain threshold.
This feature should help users create more custom bots and manage exchange rate limits better. See
, we introduce two new parameters in the Pure Market Making (PMM) strategy:
. These parameters allow you set a price band within which your bot usually acts, but the bot behaves differently if the market price moves out of the band.
This feature should help users express a view that the market will stay range-bound. See
We want to thank üôè community member
that caused the bot to leak memory after users run the
command. This caused the bot to crash unexpectedly after running for a while. This issue is now fixed.
The Kraken exchange connector, which we released in
, had several bugs. In this release, we have fixed a number of Kraken related bugs, including
This connector should be much more stable going forward.

order type by default for maker orders on Binance. This order type prevents your bot from making crossed orders that would be taken automatically. This feature should help users set tight spreads more effectively.
, you can hook up the Hummingbot client to external SQL databases. See
